stories.text:
I was reading through an old post: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=25176531

I noticed someone posted a URL to a website containing lots of interesting small C libraries: https://ccodearchive.net/list.html

I was wondering if anyone has a small lesser known library (created or found) that they use and that they'd like to share.
stories.title: Ask HN: What is a snippet/small lib of C code that you include on every project?

stories.text:
I can't stand switching between 2 apps to define and know what's supposed to happen in my day.

In a typical day, there are events, there are todo actions defined at a specific time, and there are todo actions that I need to complete before the end of a the day.

Events do not require user completion and will happen no matter what, unlike todos actions.

Is there any app (macOS / web) that can manage both events and todo actions? Am I the only one to not understand why calendars and todo apps are generally splited?
stories.title: Ask HN: Any app that merges todolist and calendar?
UK approves ‘first of its kind’ Covid artificial antibodies treatment
